thread.title: Bon Jovi honours late high school football player, Evan Murray
thread.title_full: Bon Jovi honours late high school football player, Evan Murray

title: Bon Jovi honours late high school football player, Evan Murray
text:
Bon Jovi honours late high school football player, Evan Murray Bon Jovi honours late high school football player, Evan Murray 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Jon Bon Jovi made an on-stage gesture to honour a high school football player who died on the playing field in New Jersey. 
The New Jersey rocker placed a sticker with 17-year-old Evan Murray’s number 18 on his guitar during a concert in the United Arab Emirates and posted a tribute to him online. Sending support and prayers to the family, friends, and teammates of Evan Murray. #18Strong http://t.co/04qrp2j89q pic.twitter.com/IFs7cQbpg7 
— Bon Jovi (@BonJovi) October 1, 2015 
“I heard word about Evan and as a father and as a father of football players, my heart, my prayers and my thoughts go out to the Murray family,” Bon Jovi said in the video posted to YouTube. 
“To all the team, I wish you the best this season and keep it up guys, all right? Win one for Evan.” 
Authorities said Murray, who played for Warren Hills Regional High School in Washington Township, died from massive internal bleeding caused by a lacerated spleen last week. RIP Evan Murray, played this kid so much on the baseball field. Great kid and great athlete you will truly be missed pic.twitter.com/c6uEai0kAf 
— C.J. Schaible (@CJ_Schibs7) September 26, 2015 
The funeral for the popular three-sport star and honours student was held on October 1. Share article 
Bon Jovi’s son, Jesse Bongiovi, made it onto Notre Dame’s football team as a walk-on in 2013. Promoted Stories
